A **crystal chest** is a type of [tool](/wiki/Tool "Tool") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"). It is a [magical](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item") [container](/wiki/Container "Container") that is made of [gemstone](/wiki/Gemstone "Gemstone").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

In addition to randomly generating very rarely, several crystal chests can be found at preset locations around the dungeon and its branches:

- The [Ice Queen's Realm](/wiki/Ice_Queen%27s_Realm "Ice Queen's Realm") generates a crystal chest in a random location on the first floor. On the last floor, four crystal chests are placed within the corners of the castle room containing [Kathryn the Ice Queen](/wiki/Kathryn_the_Ice_Queen "Kathryn the Ice Queen"), with a fifth in the small room where the [pegasus](/wiki/Pegasus "Pegasus") is held:

  - The lower-right crystal chest has 3 [apples](/wiki/Apple "Apple"), 3 [oranges](/wiki/Orange "Orange"), 3 potions of [acid](/wiki/Potion_of_acid "Potion of acid"), an uncursed [saddle](/wiki/Saddle "Saddle"), and a 1⁄5 chance of a [barding](/wiki/Barding "Barding") item, which will either be [spiked barding](/wiki/Spiked_barding "Spiked barding") (4⁄5 chance) or [barding of reflection](/wiki/Barding_of_reflection "Barding of reflection") (1⁄5 chance).
  - The crystal chest in the pegasus cage contains the [Bag of the Hesperides](/wiki/Bag_of_the_Hesperides "Bag of the Hesperides"), with a 1⁄10 chance of a [magic marker](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker") appearing as well.

- The [Hidden Dungeon](/wiki/Hidden_Dungeon "Hidden Dungeon") generates a crystal chest on [Tal'Gaths](/wiki/Tal%27Gath "Tal'Gath") square in the northwestern-most corner. The chest contains two random [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion"), a random [scroll](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll"), a random [spellbook](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook"), a random [amulet](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet"), two random [rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring"), and a 3⁄20 chance of a [magic marker](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker").

- The last floor of [Vecna's Domain](/wiki/Vecna%27s_Domain "Vecna's Domain") has a crystal chest situated behind the [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") where [Vecna](/index.php?title=Vecna_\(EvilHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Vecna (EvilHack) (page does not exist)") himself resides, with the following contents: 20000 [zorkmids](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid"), four uncursed [gems](/wiki/Gem "Gem"), two uncursed scrolls, one blessed scroll, a single ring of each beatitude, an uncursed amulet, a blessed amulet, a cursed potion, a blessed potion, three uncursed spellbooks, one cursed spellbook, one blessed spellbook, and a 1⁄5 chance of a magic marker.

Crystal chests do not generate as trapped like other containers.

## Description

The crystal chest can only be locked or unlocked by magical means, preventing [intelligent monsters](/wiki/Intelligent_monster "Intelligent monster") from looting them, and is immune to other forms of magic. The following items and spells are capable of (un)locking a crystal chest:

- [spell of knock](/wiki/Spell_of_knock "Spell of knock")
- [spell of wizard lock](/wiki/Spell_of_wizard_lock "Spell of wizard lock")
- [wand of opening](/wiki/Wand_of_opening "Wand of opening")
- [wand of locking](/wiki/Wand_of_locking "Wand of locking")
- the blessed [Bell of Opening](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening "Bell of Opening")
- [The Master Key of Thievery](/wiki/The_Master_Key_of_Thievery "The Master Key of Thievery")
- [The Platinum Yendorian Express Card](/wiki/The_Platinum_Yendorian_Express_Card "The Platinum Yendorian Express Card")

## Strategy

The crystal chest is the most ideal container to use as a [stash](/wiki/Stash "Stash") for characters along with the [magic chest](/wiki/Magic_chest "Magic chest"): it lacks the ability to access its contents from multiple locations, but cannot be [canceled](/wiki/Canceled "Canceled"), [teleported](/wiki/Teleport "Teleport") or [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph"), and cannot be unlocked by intelligent monsters with a [magic key](/index.php?title=Magic_key\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Magic key (page does not exist)") like the magic chest can. Its magic immunity also makes it immune to a [wand of probing](/wiki/Wand_of_probing "Wand of probing"), which can be slightly inconvenient.

## Encyclopedia entry

Dantes rapidly cleared away the earth around the chest. Soon  
the center lock appeared, then the handles at each end, all  
delicately wrought in the manner of that period when art made  
precious even the basest of metals. He took the chest by the  
two handles and tried to lift it, but it was impossible. He  
tried to open it; it was locked. He inserted the sharp end  
of his pickaxe between the chest and the lid and pushed down  
on the handle. The lid creaked, then flew open.  
Dantes was seized with a sort of giddy fever. He cocked his  
gun and placed it beside him. The he closed his eyes like a  
child, opened them and stood dumbfounded.  
The chest was divided into three compartments. In the first  
were shining gold coins. In the second, unpolished gold  
ingots packed in orderly stacks. From the third compartment,  
which was half full, Dantes picked up handfuls of diamonds,  
pearls and rubies. As they fell through his fingers in a  
glittering cascade, they gave forth the sound of hail beating  
against the windowpanes.

\[ The Count of Monte Cristo, by Alexandre Dumas ]
